abstract.text: Requests the user’s permission to use location services regardless of whether the app is in use.

Core Location limits calls to

. After your app calls this method, further calls have no effect. If a compatible iPad or iPhone app calls this method when running in visionOS, the method treats it as a request for When in Use authorization instead.

content.text: Request Always Authorization After Getting When In Use

inlineContent.text: To obtain Always authorization, your app must first request When In Use permission followed by requesting Always authorization.
If the user grants When In Use permission after your app calls
, then calling
immediately prompts the user to request Always permission. If the user responded to
with Allow Once, then Core Location ignores further calls to
due to the temporary authorization.

In iOS 16 and later, apps that actively track a user’s location or that have recently enabled Core Location display an indicator in Control Center. Be mindful of battery use and user privacy by monitoring the device’s location only when necessary and when the user expects it.
Core Location prompts the user to grant permission with the string from
. The user prompt displays the following options, which determine the authorization your app can receive:
Option
Authorization
Keep Only While Using
Core Location leaves the authorization as When In Use. The delegate doesn’t receive any updates.
Change to Always Allow
Core Location grants your app Always authorization. The delegate receives
If your app’s current state is
and you call
, Core Location uses two prompts before it fully enables Always authorization.
The first prompt displays immediately with the string from
. The user prompt displays the following options, which determine the authorization your app receives:
Option
Authorization
Allow While Using App
Core Location grants your app a Provisional Always authorization. The delegate receives
Allow Once
Core Location grants your app a Temporary When in Use authorization. The delegate receives
. This authorization expires when your app is no longer in use, reverting to
Don’t Allow
Core Location marks your app with Denied authorization. The delegate receives
The second prompt displays when Core Location prepares to deliver an event to your app requiring
. If the app is in the Provisional Always state, the system displays the second prompt with the string from
. Core Location will typically display the second prompt when your app isn’t running.

Your app receives permanent Always authorization if the user chooses to grant permission when the second prompt appears while in the Provisional Always state. When the user responds, your app receives either the location event or a call to your delegate with the modified authorization.
When displaying the second prompt, the user sees one of the following options:
Option
Authorization
Keep Only While Using
Core Location changes the authorization to When In Use. The delegate receives
Change to Always Allow
Core Location removes the provisional status, making the Always authorization permanent. The delegate doesn’t receive a callback.
If the user responds to the prompt near the time it was delivered and chooses to allow the Always permission, the location event will be delivered to your app.

abstract.text: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.
Constants that indicate the app’s authorization to use location services.
The user authorized the app to start location services at any time.
The user authorized the app to start location services while it is in use.
The user denied the use of location services for the app or they are disabled globally in Settings.
The user has not chosen whether the app can use location services.
The object you use to start and stop the delivery of location-related events to your app.
The current authorization status for the app.
Requests the user’s permission to use location services regardless of whether the app is in use.
Requests permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy.
Requests permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy and reports the results to the provided completion handler.
Requests the user’s permission to use location services while the app is in use.
Tells the delegate that new location data is available.
Add and configure an extension to enable your location-sharing app to access a user’s location in response to a request from another user.

doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentati.title: Creating a location push service extension

abstract.text: A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the user’s location information at all times.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the user’s location at all times.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the app requests reduced location accuracy by default.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the user’s location information while the app is running in the foreground.
